intro: Cynoglossospermum semiglabrum, commonly known as the smooth tongue grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. The plant is typically found in arid and semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. It has a creeping growth habit and is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological and medicinal studies.
